intro: Stenandrium guineense, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with a compact, bushy habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
